Question.Subject: Why can't I right-click in Firefox anymore?
Question.Content:
Every now and then, I lose the ability to right-click in Firefox. Usually restarting FF or my computer solves the problem, but now it's not working. It's definitely not a problem with my computer itself because right-click works fine in all my programs and Google Chrome. What should I do? Yes, I mean I can't right-click to open a new tab, save pictures, view properties, etc.
I'll try the Yahoo toolbar thing, thanks.
Question.ChosenAnswer:
do u have yahoo toolbar?
go to tools add-ons and uninstall yahoo toolbar
its a bug on yahoo toolbar

Answer.Content: Do you mean right click to show all the options on the menu like Open, properties etc? If so try reinstalling firefox remember to make a backup of your favourites.

do u have yahoo toolbar?
go to tools add-ons and uninstall yahoo toolbar
its a bug on yahoo toolbar
I concur with pelon. I fixed this on a friend's computer yesterday. He had Yahoo toolbar.
